definition: acting or capable of acting with speed: such as

fast in development or occurrence                                      
             
             a quick succession of events

done or taking place with rapidity                                      
             
             gave them a quick look

fast in understanding, thinking, or learning : mentally agile                                      
             
             a quick wit
reacting to stimuli with speed and keen sensitivity

aroused immediately and intensely                                      
             
             quick tempers

marked by speed, readiness, or promptness of physical movement                                      
             
             walked with quick steps

inclined to hastiness (as in action or response)                                      
             
             quick to criticize

capable of being easily and speedily prepared                                      
             
             a quick and tasty dinner

having a sharp angle                                      
             
             a quick turn in the road
not dead : living, alive

moving, shifting                                      
             
             quick mud
not stagnant : running, flowing
fiery, glowing
pregnant
pungent
caustic
in a quick manner
a painfully sensitive spot or area of flesh (such as that underlying a fingernail or toenail)

the inmost sensibilities                                      
             
             hurt to the quick by the remark
the very center of something : heart
living beings
life sense 11
done or happening in a short amount of time
fast in thinking, learning, or understanding
fast in moving or reacting
in a fast or quick manner

done or taking place in a very short period of time                                      
             
             a quick look

very swift : speedy                                      
             
             quick steps

fast in learning or understanding : mentally alert                                      
             
             a quick mind

easily stirred up                                      
             
             a quick temper
a very tender area of flesh (as under a fingernail)

someone's innermost feelings                                      
             
             She was hurt to the quick by the remark.

definition: able to move fast or do something fast
able to understand things very easily
done or happening in a short time
in: He’s surprisingly quick for such a big man.
a quick worker
a quick learner
He took a quick glance over his shoulder.
a series of quick nervous movements
in quick succession  (=one after the other with little time between them): Three explosions were heard in quick succession.
be quick
be quick on your feet
be quick to do something
have a quick temper
make a quick buck
a quick one

definition: happening or done with great speed, or lasting only a short time:
doing something fast:
to do something fast, sometimes too fast:
used to describe someone who is clever and understands or notices things quickly:
someone who is able to learn things quickly:
produced quickly and therefore not perfect:
used for telling someone to do something quickly:
quickly:
the area of flesh under your nails:
done, happening, or moving fast; lasting only a short time:
in: It's a quick journey.
I had a quick coffee and left the house.
I only had time for a quick glance at the paper this morning.
He scored three goals in quick succession (= one after the other in a short time).
Could I have a quick word (= speak to you for a short time)?

I tried to catch him but he was too quick for me.

definition:
1. To climax extremely fast. To come in a short period of time.
2. A nickname for someone who the above regularly happens to.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
To do something extremely slowly.
or nesquick. chocolate milk.
